page.title: 13ECOLOGY
page.content: In our school area there are many intresting walks. Much of the area was originally farmland, and many landmarks can still be seen today, when out walking. From the{Steadings Inn,}which was once the steadings of a local farm, you can view the sea above the rooftops of the town. Walking back along{Dunearn Drive,}we pass the site of the old quarry,which now contains the Dunearn Roadhouse. In following the Valley stream, which flows along{Valley Gardens,}and through Wilson Avenue Park, we come to the{giant tree}which has stood here since before the houses were built in the 1930's. The area has several interesting trails to follow, many of which are outlined in our headmaster's{"Local {Links"}book.
